articles.description: Full live text and BBC Radio 5 Live commentary presents live golf coverage from day four of The Open at the Royal Portrush Golf Club.
articles.title: The Open 2025 LIVE: Final round leaderboard, golf scores & radio from Royal Portrush

articles.description: BBC Sport looks at where Oleksandr Usyk ranks among the all-time heavyweight greats and who in the current generation could beat him.
articles.title: Usyk vs Dubois 2: Oleksandr Usyk & 'Ivan' - the untouchable duo who can't be beaten?

articles.description: Belgian road champion Tim Wellens claims his first Tour de France stage victory with a breakaway win on stage 15.
articles.title: Tour de France 2025 results: Tim Wellens cruises to maiden Tour win on stage 15

articles.description: The Lions finished the first Test sloppily but at their best they're streets ahead of the Wallabies, writes Tom English.
articles.title: British and Irish Lions 2025: 'Desperation driving Australia - but it only gets you so far'

articles.description: England defender Jess Carter says she will take a step back from social media after experiencing "a lot of racial abuse" during Euro 2025, with police called in to investigate further.
articles.title: Jess Carter: England defender to step away from social media after 'a lot of racial abuse' at Euros

articles.description: View the latest Majors Golf Leaderboard on BBC Sport.
articles.title: Majors Leaderboard - Golf - BBC Sport

articles.description: British number one Jack Draper withdraws from the forthcoming Canadian Open and Cincinnati Open with an arm injury, but targets a return at the US Open.
articles.title: Jack Draper: Briton targets US Open return after arm injury

articles.description: The penalty shootout between England and Sweden at Euro 2025 will go down as one of the most dramatic in football history - but it was not an outlier at the tournament. BBC Sport investigates why spot-kicks are being missed.
articles.title: Euro 2025: Pressure and better keepers - why penalties are being missed?

articles.description: Li Hoatong was once dubbed "the most handsome man in China" and, after nearly walking away from the sport, will try and beat Scottie Scheffler at The Open.
articles.title: Li Hoatong: Who is the Chinese golfer challenging Scottie Scheffler for The Open?

articles.description: The International Cricket Council awards the next three World Test Championship finals to the England and Wales Cricket Board.
articles.title: World Test Championship: England to host next three finals - ICC announces
